mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Benjamin Rush [Philadelphia], to Bushrod Washington, 1812 May 2
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Rush, Benjamin, 1746-1813
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Physician Benjamin Rush advises Bushrod Washington on his wife's treatment "to complete the conquest which Mrs. Washington has happily made in part over her attachment to laudanum" -- Rush directs a gradual lessening of the dose to nothing -- suggests various infusions, including ginger tea, bitters, spirits of hartshorne, & strong porter or wine -- asks Bushrod to pass on his words that "the habitual use of opium is often attended with the most serious and distressing consequences [including] idiotism and madness" -- he hopes her resolution to be cured is equal to her judgment on the subject of the letter. Autograph letter signed, 2 pages, docketed by B.W. "Doct. Rush Advice for Mrs. Washington", laminated.
